It is encountered as the anydrous form and also as the tetrahydrate, ZnF<sub>2</sub> · 4H<sub>2</sub>O (rhombohedral crystal structure).<ref>{{ cite book | author = Perry, D. L.; Phillips, S. L. | year = 1995 | title = Handbook of Inorganic Compounds | publisher = CRC Press | isbn = 0-8493-8671-3 }}</ref> It has a high melting point and has the [[titanium dioxide|rutile]] structure containing 6 coordinate zinc, which suggests appreciable ionic character in its chemical bonding.<ref name = "Greenwood">{{Greenwood&Earnshaw}}</ref> Unlike the other zinc halides, ZnCl<sub>2</sub>, ZnBr<sub>2</sub> and ZnI<sub>2</sub>, it is not very soluble in water.<ref name = "Greenwood">{{Greenwood&Earnshaw}}</ref> ==Preparation and reactions== Zinc fluoride can be synthesized several ways. *Reaction of a [[fluoride]] salt with [[zinc chloride]], to yield zinc fluoride and a chloride salt, in aqueous solution.{{Fact|date=January 2009}} *The reaction of [[zinc]] metal with [[fluorine]] gas.<ref name = "Greenwood"/> *Reaction of [[hydrofluoric acid]] with zinc, to yield [[hydrogen]] gas (H<sub>2</sub>) and zinc fluoride (ZnF<sub>2</sub>).<ref name = "Greenwood"/> Zinc fluoride can be hydrolysed by hot water to form the zinc hydroxyfluoride, Zn(OH)F.<ref>{{ cite journal | author = Srivastava, O. K.; Secco, E. A. | title = Studies on Metal Hydroxy Compounds. I. Thermal Analyses of Zinc Derivatives ε-Zn(OH)<sub>2</sub>, Zn<sub>5</sub>(OH)<sub>8</sub>Cl<sub>2</sub> · H<sub>2</sub>O, β-ZnOHCl, and ZnOHF | journal = Canadian Journal of Chemistry | year = 1967 | volume = 45 | issue = 6 | pages = 579−583 | doi = 10.1139/v67-096 | url = http://www.nrcresearchpress.com/doi/pdf/10.1139/v67-096 | format = pdf }}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{ cite web | url = http://www.americanelements.com/znf.html | title = Zinc Fluoride | publisher = [[American Elements]] }} {{Zinc compounds}} [[Category:Fluorides]] [[Category:Metal halides]] [[Category:Zinc compounds]] [[Category:Inorganic compound stubs]] {{inorganic-compound-stub}}
